Event.name: Performers_and_roles
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Performer</fen> has a certain <fen>Role</fen> in a <fen>Performance</fen> and plays their part by following the directions in the <fen>Script</fen> for that particular <fen>Role</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Performer">Margaret Thatcher</fex> <t>played</t> <fex name="Role">Juliet</fex> <fex name="Performance">in a school play</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Performance">"Pulp Fiction"</fex> <t>starred</t> <fex name="Performer">John Travolta and a lot of other big names</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Performer">Mel Gibson</fex> <t>starred</t> <fex name="Performance">in "Braveheart"</fex> <fex name="Role">as the leader of a Scottish rebellion</fex>.</ex> <ex>I play the <t>character</t> <fex name="Role">of Yusuf</fex> in this film.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Performer</fen> to transmit the <fen>Performance</fen> to the <fen>Audience</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Score
Arg.definition: <def-root>The music which may be performed in the <fen>Performance</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.</def-root>

Arg.name: Script
Arg.definition: <def-root>The (usually written) directions which instruct the <fen>Performer</fen>s on what actions to perform, when, and how. It has many different names depending on the <fen>Type</fen> of <fen>Performance</fen> including <ment>script</ment>, <ment>screenplay</ment>, <ment>libretto</ment>, <ment>book</ment>, and <ment>choreography</ment>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Type
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the subtype of <fen>Performance</fen>, including <ment>dance</ment>, <ment>theater</ment>, <ment>film</ment>, etc. </def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Role</fen> identifies one of the possible relations that the <fen>Performer</fen> can have to the <fen>Performance</fen>. The <fen>Role</fen> (s) a <fen>Performer</fen> has in the <fen>Performance</fen> will determine which parts of the <fen>Script</fen> should be performed by the <fen>Performer</fen>, as the <fen>Script</fen> is written in terms of which <fen>Role</fen> (s) each set of instructions applies to. In the fields of theater, movies, ballet, and opera, a <fen>Role</fen> generally corresponds to a character in the story of the <fen>Script</fen>, while other types of performance may use more general <fen>Role</fen>s like <ment>lead violinist</ment>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> an event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Performer1
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person that performs alongside Performer2. <ex>He <t>co-starred</t> <fex name="Perf1">with Matt Perry</fex> in Tool 3.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Performer2
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person that is also in the Performance, alongside Performer1. <ex>Who <t>co-starred</t> <fex name="Perf2">with Glen Close</fex> in that space opera thingy?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>How long the <fen>Performer</fen> is in the <fen>Performance</fen>. <ex>She <t>starred</t> in Cats <fex name="Dur">for several years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is an appraisal or description of the performance event.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: star.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have (someone) as a principal performer.

lexUnit.name: act.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perform a fictional role in a play or film.

lexUnit.name: play.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: . represent (a character) in a play or film

lexUnit.name: be.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: perform in the role of

lexUnit.name: co-star.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a performer appearing with another or others of equal importance.

lexUnit.name: co-star (in).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: appear in a production as a co-star.

lexUnit.name: lead.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the chief part in a play or film.

lexUnit.name: star (in).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have a principal role in a film, play, etc.

lexUnit.name: as.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: playing in the role of

lexUnit.name: feature.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have as an important actor or participant.

lexUnit.name: character.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a part played by an actor.

lexUnit.name: role.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an actor's part in a play, film, etc.

lexUnit.name: part.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a role played by an actor or actress.

lexUnit.name: appear.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to perform in a play or film
